title:
JSX Comments: `
{/* */}
` does not work
body:
```
{/* */}
``` Is transformed to: ``` React.DOM.div(null, /* */) ``` Note the trailing `,` - this results in a syntax error. The problem seems to be with comma insertion in `visitReactTag()` and related functions (e.g, `renderXJSLiteral()`). See IRC discussion below for my findings. Relevant parts of an IRC discussion: ``` 12:33:47 PM JSX comments seem buggy - `
{/* comment */}
` generates `React.DOM.div(null, /* comment */)` - which is a syntax error 12:40:52 PM <@lbljeffmo> def looks like a bug -- that comma shouldn't be there. File an issue? (or better -- look into the transform and see if you can send a PR? :) https://github.com/facebook/react/tree/master/vendor/fbtransform/transforms ) 1:21:30 PM lbljeffmo: looks like comment nodes are of type `XJSExpressionContainer` with an inner expression of type `XJSEmptyExpression` - does this sound like the right thing to be looking for? 1:22:12 PM <@lbljeffmo> parshap: off the top of my head, yea that sounds about right 1:35:50 PM lbljeffmo: It doesn't look like it will be possible to fix without a nontrivial refactor of `visitReactTag()`. The problem is that the commas are injected from several different callsites, often when the next node is not in scope to test wether it is a comment (e.g., inside `renderXJSLiteral()`. I don't have much more time to spend on it so I will just open 1:35:50 PM an issue. 1:38:31 PM lbljeffmo: looks like you've already worked on this issue? https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/82#issuecomment-19589375 1:38:59 PM <@balpert> parshap: that was #136 1:39:00 PM <@lbljeffmo> parshap: that was just to add support for XJSEmptyExpression in the parser 1:39:00 PM <+reactbotx> Issue 136: Add support for empty XJS expressions https://github.com/facebook/react/issues/136 1:39:21 PM <@balpert> syranide's diff might fix that comment thing though, I dunno 1:39:43 PM <@lbljeffmo> parshap: understand if you don't have the time. Thanks for looking though -- if you want to open an issue and include all the info you found that would be super helpful ```
